title: Reconstructing a Heavy Neutral Lepton at the LHC
authors: Pablo de la Torre, Manuel Masip, Fuensanta Vilches
abstract:
Heavy lepton singlets $N$ slightly mixed with a standard neutrino $\nu_\ell$
are usually searched for at the LHC in the trilepton plus $p_{\rm T}^{\rm
miss}$ channel: $pp \to W^+ \to \ell^+ N$ with $N\to \ell^- W^+ \to \ell^-
\ell'^+ \nu$. We show that, although the longitudinal momentum of the final
$\nu$ escapes detection, the mass of the heavy lepton can be reconstructed.
This possibility has been overlooked in recent LHC searches. For $m_N\approx
90$--$130$ GeV and the current luminosity (138 fb$^{-1}$ at 13 TeV), we
estimate that the reconstruction could set bounds on $|V_{\ell N}|^2$ around
$4\times 10^{-4}$, versus the $2\times 10^{-3}$ limit obtained at CMS or
$|V_{\ell N}|^2< 10^{-3}$ from flavor and electroweak precision data.
